vulnerability_findings.name: inefficient-state-variable-increment
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function nonPureMethod() public returns(uint) { return someState += 1; }
vulnerability_findings.message: <x> += <y> costs more gas than <x> = <x> + <y> for state variables.

vulnerability_findings.name: inefficient-state-variable-increment
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: function nonPureMethodThatReturnsNothing() public { someState += 1; }
vulnerability_findings.message: <x> += <y> costs more gas than <x> = <x> + <y> for state variables.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: revert("SIMPLE_REVERT");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: use-custom-error-not-require
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: require(0 > 1, "SIMPLE_REQUIRE");
vulnerability_findings.message: Consider using custom errors as they are more gas efficient while allowing developers  to describe the error in detail using NatSpec.

vulnerability_findings.name: pragma
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: pragma experimental ABIEncoderV2;
vulnerability_findings.message:
Different versions of Solidity is used in AbiGenDummy.sol:
	- Version used: ['ABIEncoderV2', '^0.5.5']
	- AbiGenDummy.sol#21 declares pragma experimentalABIEncoderV2
	- AbiGenDummy.sol#23 declares pragma solidity^0.5.5

vulnerability_findings.name: Integer Arithmetic Bugs (SWC 101)
vulnerability_findings.vulnerability_code: return 1 + x;
vulnerability_findings.message:
The arithmetic operator can overflow.
It is possible to cause an integer overflow or underflow in the arithmetic operation. 
Classification: SWC-101
